question: You are a coding expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for demonstration. Please create a gamified web-based design for the knowledge points of 8th grade Modern Chinese History (People's Education Press edition), and provide the specific code.

checklist.title: Is the core historical content accurately represented?
checklist.description: Verify if the code accurately implements the key knowledge points from the 8th grade Modern Chinese History curriculum (People's Education Press edition), including critical historical events (1840-1949), important figures, and historical significance. Score 0 if major historical events are missing or inaccurately portrayed, 5 if basic content is present but lacks depth, and 10 if comprehensive coverage with proper historical context is provided.

checklist.title: Is the gamification system effectively designed?
checklist.description: Evaluate the implementation of game mechanics such as scoring systems, achievement badges, level progression, challenges/quizzes, and reward mechanisms that enhance learning. Check if the game elements are aligned with educational objectives rather than being merely decorative. Deduct 5 points if gamification is superficial (e.g., only points without meaningful progression), and 3 points if engagement mechanics don't reinforce historical knowledge. Full score for a comprehensive system that balances entertainment with educational value.

checklist.title: Is the interactive learning experience properly implemented?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code implements interactive elements like timeline exploration, historical scenario simulations, decision-making activities based on historical events, or knowledge verification quizzes. Verify that interactions provide meaningful feedback that reinforces learning. Deduct 5 points if interactions are limited to basic clicking without educational value, 3 points if feedback mechanisms are missing. Full score requires diverse interaction types that support different learning styles.

checklist.title: Does the visualization support historical comprehension?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes effective visual aids such as interactive maps showing territorial changes, timelines of events, historical photographs/illustrations, or data visualizations of historical trends. Visuals should clarify complex historical concepts rather than just decorate. Deduct 5 points for inaccurate historical visuals, 3 points for poor visual hierarchy that obscures historical relationships. Full score for visualizations that genuinely enhance understanding of historical cause and effect.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as incorrect user input, browser compatibility issues, responsive design challenges, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the learning experience (e.g., 1. AR/VR components for historical immersion 2. Voice narration with historical context 3. Adaptive learning paths based on user performance). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple quiz systems with different mechanics) 2. Function modules unrelated to history education (e.g., mini-games without historical context) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations that distract from learning). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core educational functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating educational content/game mechanics/UI layers), maintainability for content updates, and performance optimization. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if no consideration is given to loading performance for educational resources. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern educational design principles: 1) Age-appropriate visuals for 8th graders 2) Proper information hierarchy highlighting key historical concepts 3) Consistent design language that aids navigation through historical periods. Deduct 3 points for each visually overwhelming screen, 5 points for inappropriate visual metaphors for historical events, and 5 points for text-heavy interfaces without proper visual support. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and pedagogically sound?
checklist.description: Judge whether the interactions support the learning process: 1) Clear feedback on correct/incorrect historical knowledge 2) Progressive disclosure of complex historical concepts 3) Intuitive navigation between related historical events. Deduct 5 points for each learning interaction without feedback, 3 points for transitions that break the historical narrative flow, and 5 points for interactivity that prioritizes entertainment over educational value. The full score is 10 points.
